title: Patrick Bengondo
text:
Patrick Alphonse Bengondo (born 27 September 1981) is a former <a href="Cameroon">Cameroon</a>ian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Bengondo began his career in his native <a href="Cameroon">Cameroon</a> playing for <a href="Olympic%20Mvoly%C3%A9">Olympic Mvolyé</a>. In 2000, he moved to <a href="Switzerland">Switzerland</a> to play for <a href="%C3%89toile%20Carouge%20FC">Étoile Carouge FC</a> where he played for the <a href="2001/2002%20football%20season%20in%20Switzerland">2001–02</a> season before <a href="Transfer%20%28football%29">transferring</a> to <a href="AC%20Bellinzona">AC Bellinzona</a>. Success there earned him a move to <a href="Romania">Romania</a> to play for <a href="FC%20Universitatea%20Craiova">Universitatea Craiova</a>. Injury limited his chances there and after only five appearances in the <a href="Divizia%20A%202003%E2%80%9304">2003–04 season</a> he returned to <a href="Switzerland">Switzerland</a> to play for GC Biaschesi for the 2004/05 season.
For the 2005/06 season Bengondo played in the 2nd tier of Swiss football the <a href="Swiss%20Challenge%20League">Swiss Challenge League</a> for <a href="FC%20Winterthur">Winterthur</a>. A return of 18 goals in 31 games earned him a move to <a href="Swiss%20Super%20League">Super League</a> side <a href="FC%20Aarau">FC Aarau</a>. Bengondo failed to settle in his first spell at <a href="Stadion%20Br%C3%BCgglifeld">Stadion Brugglifeld</a> and soon moved to <a href="Geneva">Geneva</a> to play for the once-great <a href="Servette%20FC">Servette</a>. For the <a href="Swiss%20Challenge%20League%202007-08">2007/08</a> season Bengondo was again on the move – this time to play at <a href="FC%20Winterthur">FC Winterthur</a>. For the <a href="Swiss%20Super%20League%202008%E2%80%9309">2008/09 season</a> Bengondo made a return to <a href="Stadion%20Br%C3%BCgglifeld">Brugglifeld</a> to play for <a href="FC%20Aarau">FC Aarau</a>.
In June 2011, Patrick went on trial with <a href="Scottish%20Premier%20League">Scottish Premier League</a> side <a href="Aberdeen%20F.C.">Aberdeen</a>. In Aberdeen's first pre-season friendly in advance of the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Aberdeen%20F.C.%20season">2011-12 season</a>, which was against <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League%20Second%20Division">Scottish Second Division</a> side <a href="Brechin%20City%20F.C.">Brechin City</a> on 30 June 2011, he played as a trialist and scored Aberdeen's second goal in a 3–1 victory. Patrick spent time on trial in July 2011 with <a href="Benevento%20Calcio">Benevento Calcio</a> in Italy and <a href="Hastings%20United%20F.C.">Hastings United F.C.</a> in England. Patrick eventually signed for <a href="FC%20Winterthur">FC Winterthur</a> on 7 November 2011 and scored on his debut against <a href="BSC%20Young%20Boys">Young Boys</a> in the <a href="Swiss%20Cup">Swiss Cup</a> on 27 November 2011.
